english_translation: Narrated by Humayd ibn Hilal: Zaid ibn Suuhan came to Uthman ibn Affan and said: O Commander of the Faithful, you have deviated so your nation has deviated. english_translation: Narrated by Ibn Awn: Abdullah ibn Shaddad was the brother (from the mother's side) of the daughter of Hamzah. Ibn Awn said: And Hisham ibn Muhammad ibn al-Sa'ib said: The mother of Abdullah ibn Shaddad ibn al-Had was Salmā bint Umayyah al-Khath'ami, sister of Asmā bint Umayyah. She was the wife of Hamzah ibn Abd al-Muttalib and bore him a daughter named Umārah. Then Hamzah ibn Abd al-Muttalib was killed on the day of Uhud. She then married Shaddad ibn al-Had and bore Abdullah ibn Shaddad, who was from the companions of Ali. And he narrated from Umar.

english_translation: Hisham ibn Muhammad ibn al-Sa'ib said from his father: The Prophet ﷺ wrote to Harash ibn Juhash and he tore the letter. Rab'i ibn Harash narrated from Umar and Ali and Kharshah ibn al-Harr. A narrator said: Hajjaj asked Shu'bah: Did Rab'i see Ali? Shu'bah said: Yes, he narrated from Ali but did not say he heard from him. Rab'i ibn Harash died during the reign of al-Hajjaj ibn Yusuf after the battles, and he had no offspring, but his brother Mas'ud ibn Harash had offspring. Mas'ud also narrated from Umar. Their brother Rabi' ibn Harash is the one about whom people spoke after his death. But Abu Nu'aym said: Rab'i died in the caliphate of Umar ibn Abd al-Aziz, and he was trustworthy with good hadiths, and Rab'i died in the year 101.
